title: Which of these sentences are toxic and report able if any?
body:
Yes/No for each:

1) could you please stop feeding?

2) could you please stop trolling?

3) could you please stop being stupid/retarded/ignorant/brainless?

4) could please you stop farming and gank?

5) could you please just AFK so you don't feed?

6) could please get out of my lane?

7) could you please fuck/piss off?

8) could you please stop farming and attack the enemy?

9) could you please stop farming and gank my lane?

10) could you please uninstall the game?

11) could you please just play coop vs ai from now on until you learn the game?

12) could you please just kill yourself?

replies.body:
I'm not going to give a simple "Yes/No" for them, but I'll give my opinion on the statements themselves.

1) Not helpful and rude (seriously. Telling them to "stop feeding" is not actually helping them to stop feeding if they're doing it unintentionally).

2) Not helpful and rude (it's especially rude if they believe that they aren't trolling)

3) Not helpful and rude

4) It's fine so long as you haven't been continuing to badger them. They are in control of their actions in the game.

5) Not helpful and rude (you're telling them to not play).

6) It's fine so long as you haven't been continuing to badger them. They are in control of their actions in the game.

7) Not helpful and very rude.

8) It's fine so long as you haven't been continuing to badger them. They are in control of their actions in the game.

9) You already had this one

10) Not helpful and very rude

11) Not helpful and very rude

12) Not helpful and extremely rude.

Ok now to clarify.  Saying "could you please" doesnt make any one of those lines less toxic or vulgar.  Remove them and they are almost the same, just in a more passive tone.  But if you remove them and look at 3, 5, 7, 10, and 12 you're left with;

3.) Stop being retarded (toxic, hate speech as well (disabilities))
5.) AFK so you don't feed (toxic)
7.) Fuck off (toxic, might actually get away with this one though)
10.) Uninstall the game (toxic)
12.) Just kill yourself (*SUPER* toxic)

Those literally do not sound any better with could you please, so they're just as toxic with or without.

All of them, depending on context. Some more than others. A few of those are going to be instant banhammer smite regardless of what else is said or done.

The system is not some runescape-tier chat filter - it keeps track of the general usage and attitude of the player as well as it can, flaming, insults, or negative behavior that is going to make someone play worse is pretty reliably detected.

I will use the assumption that each of these sentences are the ONLY thing you said in game. Because of course, if someone responds, your response to that is very crucial in whether you get punished or not.

If someone responds and you start arguing with them, every one of these sentences could lead to a punishment, but that means it's more than just the sentence, that got you punished.

I am an absolute opponent of the instant feedback system and the reporting system in general.  It punishes people for nothing, and rewards bullies.  Example: I have seen it a million times where a person with completely toxic language (homophobia, slurs, swears) gets away with chatting using those terms, yet doesn't get punished.  They get the team to bully a player for feeding or something they don't like, and so everyone reports the person getting bullied, and the victim is the one punished.  It's absolute horror.  I'm actually dealing with it now, surprise surprise.  I am VERY unhappy with this system, and I think it's hurting the game more than helping it.  With all that said, I don't understand the point AT ALL of chat if this is the sort of thing you get banned for .  My $.02
